reviews.text: Construction starts promptly at 9 AM and ends at exactly 5 PM during the weekdays ONLY. Hotel staff was honest about construction project from the beginning. Staff COULD NOT HAVE BEEN BETTER! Michael, the concierge, was excellent - hailed cabs, made tour reservations and recommendations and was extremely friendly. Hotel is very convenient to all locations in DC - 2 blocks from Trader Joe's (specialty grocery store), 2 blocks from metro (maybe less), within walking distance of Georgetown. Inside of rooms and hotel is very nice. If you want to tour the city by day and sleep at night, this is your place. VERY comfortable. Excellent value!
reviews.title: GREAT experience, perfect stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at One Washington Circle. Our first trip was excellent. There was outside renovations going on. The noise and vibrations were disturbing. It took several calss and visits to the front desk to get our room changed. It ruined the mood of our stay.
reviews.title: Disappointed at One Washington Circle

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for one night due to its very convenient proximity to the Georgetown area and the metro. The reviews about the construction happening at the hotel are pretty consistent... from 9am to 5pm Monday through Friday, you can expect some noticeable noise. Out of consideration, the hotel provides ear plugs, but they really do not help. Tip: If you are a light sleeper try to plan your day so that it involves some early sight seeing.
reviews.title: Good stay, great location

likes.disliked: — Did not have a business center inside hotel; noticeable construction noise

reviews.text: The room was well furnished--a junior executive suite--with nicely stocked kitchenette, reasonably comfortable pullout bed sofa and a queen sized bed. The hotel does not have a business center but there is an ethernet connection port for your laptop. If the price is right again (we paid $99 for the night on a promotion we found on the hotel's website) I'll definitely consider staying at One Washington Circle in the future.
reviews.title: Spacious Rooms, Convenient Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed a week for spring break - hotel was very convenient, across the circle from the Foggy Bottom metro stop. They were doing reconstruction on the balconies; the desk clerk warned us both when I called to confirm the reservation and when we checked in that it was very noisy during the day on weekdays. We were disappointed not to have a balcony, but the noise was not a problem as we were sightseeing during that time. The room was spacious, had free high-speed internet, a separate bedroom with huge walk-in closet, pull-out sofabed, 2 TVs, dining room, and kitchen. There's a Trader Joe's grocery store two blocks away. The hotel was a bit old but the room was very clean, and the maid service was daily. Desk clerk was very helpful, even providing a European plug converter when requested. We got a 7-day Metro Pass and it was perfect - we went everywhere by Metro, even to the airport. We didn't try the restaurant because my kids are picky eaters and the food at the restaurant looked too fancy for them to like.
reviews.title: Nice place ... HORRIBLE Construction project going on

reviews.text: I was a bit disappointed with the hotel. After the reviews and the price, I was expecting more.
reviews.title: It's OK

likes.disliked: — no help with bags, no concierge, limited menu

reviews.text: Pro's: VERY close to metro (Chinatown stop at GWU)
reviews.title: a little disappointed
a great room even without the view
reviews.text: Very roomy suite w/ walk- in closet. 2 blocks from Trader Joe's.

Con's: Very noisy, I could hear my neighbors. "Gourmet kitchen" is a small cave with no dishwasher. TV's are small and poorly situated, sofa bed very uncomfortable and although the lobby and hallway have been spruced up, the building looks to be an old apartment building that has been converted. Very limited room service menu.
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms, great food

reviews.text: It was over- all fine, but it didn't live up to the reviews I read.
reviews.title: Enjoy the cheap rates during construction

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel in the past and although currently under remodelling construction, it is very well maintained. Rooms were clean and well stocked with extra blankets and pillows. Great location - short drive or taxi ride to Georgetown or the Mall area.
reviews.title: Great Internet Rate for Well Maintained Suite - but under remodelling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only comment is that the day doorman/porter was VERY rude.
reviews.title: Bad management ruined our stay
Well-located - but not quietly located
reviews.text: He argued with us about parking arrangements that the night porter had made for us. VERY unprofessional man...and management needs to address that situation.

reviews.title: very disappointing
reviews.text: My sister had her wedding reception at this hotel, and her wedding block there. The hotel is cute and modern-looking, with kitchenettes in the rooms. It looks like someone may have spruced up a converted dorm to be a hotel? It was located in comfortable walking distance of the war memorials, etc. HOWEVER, on our second night, there was an absolutely raucous party going on two doors down from us. We let things go until 1 a.m., and then called down to the front desk. Nothing happened. We called again at 2, nothing happened. The front desk guy said, "I told them to be quiet, what else do you want me to do?" but we could hear every moment of that party, and no one ever came up and so much as knocked on their door. At 3 a.m. I had to go down myself and insist that we be given a room on a different floor. The front desk guy then had the gall to suggest that we pack up all our stuff and move everything to the new room, or else be out of the new room early in the morning. I told him he was crazy if he thought we would do either, and if he didn't have the management skills to handle an out-of-control party than he should call the police or be apologizing profusely, not making demands on us. We went to sleep in a different room on another floor, and sure enough at 7 a.m. the management banged on the door to wake us up. It was utterly unacceptable for anyone, and given that my sister's whole wedding reception and room block was there you would think that they would be extra considerate. In the morning we insisted that we be comped, and they agreed not to charge for the second night, which I think was the least they could have done.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is near George Washington University, close to shoppinig, accessible to the subway system.
reviews.title: Very nice with goodlocation

likes.disliked: — Some Washington Taxi drivers take high prices

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel during GWU orientation in July. It was very convenient to GWU to go back and forth through the day. The staff was for the most part friendly although as a previous guest mentioned, one of the doormen told us if we took our car out on Friday night to go out to eat as we had planned, there would not be room for us in the garage when we came back and we would have to park on the street. We ended up walking but this seemed pretty strange to me.
reviews.title: Stay at One Washington

reviews.text: The rooms were okay, not spotless but fairly clean. and also quiet. My disappointment was that the pool was closed (one of the reasons I picked the hotel) and the balconies were being replaced so our sliding door was taped shut and covered with plastic at the edges. There is no public access to a computer to look up things quickly(directions, restaurants), you can get the internet on your room tv if you want to pay $10/?hour. I would stay there again due to the access to GWU but I do feel that things could have been smoother.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

likes.disliked: — Construction (but only b/c it hampered our views)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel worked out to be perfect for our family as we really wanted the full kitchen. We knew that they were in the midst of full renovations, but the rates were too good to pass up. The doorman was pleasant, the front desk people prepared and the maid service impeccable. I can't wait to see this place when they get it all done.
reviews.title: One Washington Circle Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is in between the Mall and Georgetown and both areas are easily accessible out the front door. There's a 24 hour CVS pharmacy a half block down and there's even a Trader Joes about a block and a half away. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: My Boyfriend and I went to DC for 2 nights to see the signts and get away. I booked this hotel for a fairly decent price. I came to trip advisor and saw that they were having construction (thus the low price). The construction is only monday-friday 9-5, so it didnt really affect us as we were there Friday afternoon into the weekend. They do provide earplugs, which kinda made me laugh.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location...!
